content.question: Half-Reaction <math alttext="E naught, in volts" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi><mo>°</mo><mo> </mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>V</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> <math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus 1 electron, react to produce A g, solid" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>→</mo><mi>Ag</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> <math alttext="0.80" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.80</mn></math> <math alttext="C u with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 electrons, react to produce C u, solid" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>Cu</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>→</mo><mi>Cu</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> <math alttext="0.34" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.34</mn></math> <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 electrons, react to produce Z n, solid" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>→</mo><mi>Zn</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> <math alttext="negative 0.76" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>0</mn></mpadded><mo>.76</mo></math> A student sets up a standard galvanic cell, as shown in the diagram, and measures a voltage of <math alttext="1.10 volts" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.10</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>. Based on the standard reduction potentials in the table, which of the following will occur if the student makes a new standard cell but uses a silver wire in place of the salt bridge?

choices.label: The voltage will be greater than <math alttext="1.10 volts" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.10</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>.
The voltage will be <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math>.
The silver wire will become thinner.

<math alttext="Z n, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>Zn</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="C u, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>Cu</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> will form on the silver wire.

content.answer: The voltage will be <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math>.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
